properties.description: Situated in the heart of Basildon's Eastgate Shopping Centre, HAPPY Hub: Basildon is a bright, spacious space which supports mental health and wellness, and is open to everyone! Not only do we run a multitude of activities devised to support mental health and wellness, but we also sell merchandise specific to supporting and developing mental health through our shop, a community lounge, a safe space to come, sit and relax. You can even pick up a book from our lending library and have a read. Fancy a cuppa, not a problem our CommuniTEA Cafe offers light refreshments, sandwiches and cake. Need to work off the cake, we can help with that too in our physical activity zone, have a game of pool, play table tennis, or use our gym equipment. We also have a learning zone, so watch out for our workshops and short courses. All profits from the cafe, the shop and the sports zone, help support the work we do, as well as the army of volunteers that we have making every thing function like clockwork. The Hub invites the community to use our facilities and to get involved
properties.title: HAPPY Hub

properties.description: At Motivated Minds we aim to support the community, helping people live happier and healthier lives through the promotion of positive mental health and well-being. Working from our Wellness Space, the Happy Hub, we run various sessions and offer services that aim to boost our customers self-esteem and aid them in reaching their maximum potential. We help to provide the tools needed to take control of our mental health and well-being, helping customers to grow as individuals. The Happy Hub also works to promote positive social connections between individuals within the wider community and reaches out to support those that may be more vulnerable. The Happy Hub, open in Basildon town centre, hosts a variety of weekly sessions including discussion groups, youth clubs, social groups, physical activity promotion and crafting sessions. All our adult sessions are free to attend and youth/kids clubs operate a charge of £5 per session. The Happy Hub also offers an open space that can be utilised to escape the stresses of our everyday lives in a safe environment, or simply to grab a cup of tea and unwind in our massage chair. We also offer a Ping Pong table and some gym equipment that is free to use. The Happy Hub operates a wellness shop where wellness gifts, self-care items and self-help books can be purchased. You can find the Happy Hub on the first floor of Eastgate Shopping Centre, Basildon, next to the Entertainer. We are a Warm Space.
properties.title: Motivated Minds

properties.description: Providing information, advice and guidance about almost anything. Main Coronavirus crisis enquiry areas including debt, financial, employment, benefits, claiming universal credit, rights when self isolating. We are a Warm Space.
properties.title: Citizens Advice South Essex

properties.description: We are committed to serving individuals and their families who need help coping with mental ill health. Our drop in centre welcomes everyone who needs support no matter what the problem is, nothing is insignificant. We are that friendly face for people to chat to us without any judgement. We hug the hurt, befriend the lost and love the lonely. All of our volunteers have mental health and suicide prevention training and have lived experiences of mental ill health. SATURDAYS 12PM TO 3PM FRIDAYS 10AM TO 2PM FOR MENTAL HEALTH SUPPORT SERVICES FORTNIGHTLY TUESDAY EVENINGS 6PM TO 8PM FOR ANYONE EFFECTED BY A DEATH BY SUICIDE
properties.title: The Craig Tyler Trust

properties.description: Let’s Talk Essex is a movement to fight against Stigma and Discrimination against people with Mental Illness.   A group of volunteers share their personal experiences of living with mental Illness, we call them Ambassadors. By describing their journeys they help people understand the impact of living with mental illnesses, like Eating Disorders, Depression, Anxiety or Bipolar. The Ambassadors deliver these powerful stories through social media, Blogs, Podcasts or even running events. The movement is funded by Essex County Council with support from Mind in West Essex and The Ideas Hub Chelmsford If you have a lived experience and feel able to share this with others then you can volunteer as an Ambassador and work alongside others with similar journeys and help us to change the attitude towards mental illness. You can offer as much time as you have free to support the movement and we welcome all. Please reach out and find out how you could be a Let’s Talk Essex Ambassador
properties.title: Mind in West Essex – Let’s Talk Essex

properties.description: Welcome to Pathways Basildon Council has partnered with local providers of skills, training and career advice to support local people in a welcoming and accessible space.   Pathways is for anyone who is looking for help finding work or wants to gain new skills or retrain to enter more fulfilling, secure and better paid employment. Whether you are looking to change your career and need to update your skills, are currently unemployed and looking for work or leaving full time education and need advice on career options - the team at Pathways in Basildon Town Centre is here to help. Pathways is located in the Basildon Centre, St Martins Square, Basildon, SS14 1DL. We are open from 9am to 5pm Monday to Friday.
properties.title: Pathways

properties.description: Fortnightly games afternoon which encourages neighbours to get together especially during the winter months when it is easy to feel even more isolated indoors. Every other Wednesday 2.30-4.30pm at St. Peter’s Church Hall, Thundersley. Cards, scrabble and anything else that is brought along, such as a not too serious Quiz can be included in the fun and played. A friendly environment to chat and have a ‘cuppa’ with the neighbours. Small contribution to the cost of the hall is gratefully accepted.

properties.description: Move It or Lose It are specifically designed exercise classes that have been developed by experts to help you to improve your flexibility, aerobic health, balance and strength.   Tracy, our Move It or Lose It instructor has had specific training to run this class. All Move It or Lose It exercises can be done seated or standing, depending on your ability. We are a fun and friendly class for the over 50’s and perfect if you are starting or returning to exercise. If you have any questions about Move It or Lose It then please contact Tracy at tracy.bliss@moveitorloseit.co.uk or 07804 032873.
properties.title: Waterside Leisure – Get Active, Get Together (over 50s)
